New non-fiction for February 2016

Foolproof cooking by Mary Berry

The nation’s best-loved home cook teaches you how to cook with confidence, with over 120 delicious recipes.

Good + simple by Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley

Follow up to The art of eating well. In this new cookbook, packed with over 120 brand-new recipes, Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley strip back their principles of lifelong healthy eating to make eating well easy to understand and maintain.

Making it up as I go along by Marian Keyes

A collection of hilarious, poignant, and moving essays from Marian Keyes which will appeal to the legions of fans who read her fiction. Marian’s tales of her eye-lash extension horrors, domestic goddess attempts, and the time that she decided to become a yoga instructor will have you crying with laughter.

Uprooted: on the trail of the Green Man by Nina Lyon

Who, or what, is the Green Man, and why is this medieval image so present in our modern times? An encounter with the Green Man at an ancient Herefordshire church in the wake of catastrophic weather leads Nina Lyon into an exploration of how the foliate heads of Norman stonemasons have evolved into today’s cult symbols.

Ipswich pubs by Susan Gardiner

A unique and fascinating insight into some of Ipswich’s famous and infamous pubs, taverns and inns.
